info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 9 at 4:41AM CDT until September 10 at 1:21PM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas...
Smoky Hill River At Lindsborg affecting McPherson County.
Smoky Hill River near New Cambria affecting Saline County.
Smoky Hill River Near Mentor affecting McPherson and Saline Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas...
Mulberry Creek Near Salina affecting Saline County.
Salt Creek At Barnard affecting Lincoln County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mulberry Creek near Salina.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Widespread agricultural flooding can be expected. Depending on if high flows are present on the Saline River this may backup water on Mulberry Creek which would cause the property on the KOA campground to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:16 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
